root: ^It was the perfect place to work.
^Nice tech, good pay, cool bosses and great collegues.
^Why did I have to look into that file?
^Why couldn't I remain content with what I knew?
^What will come of my family once I'm dead?

Prologue: ^Anna: I'm Anna, I'm a scrum master with the Dreamweb
^Anna: I'll take you to the team.

g-0: ^Anna: Here we are. We're just about the start our daily. Perhaps you'd like to introduce yourself to the team?
g-1: ^The team looks at you in anticipation. It's not very large, you count five faces. It's a pretty diverse bunch.
^Perhaps it's wise to say something about your previous job experience?

c-3: ^ Just graduated from college last summer. This will be my first job. Not counting my short lived Twitch career of cource.
c-4: ^ I used to have my own online agency with my best friend. But we never got large enough to compete with the big boys. We finally sold off the company for a nice buck, but not enough to retire.
^Some teammembers have a puzzled look on their faces.
c-5: ^ I used to work for a large online agency, but got laid off two months ago when the economy went bad. I feel glad for this opportunity.
c-6: ^ I used to be a home maker before this. But the kids went off to college. So I learned to code in my spare time. Now I got this opportunity which feels really good!

g-2: ^So, no formal experience as a developer?
^Anna, I thought we would be getting a senior developer? Not an intern! (to you) No offence...

c-8: ^I'm sorry, we have pretty ambitious plans for our product. We were hoping to speed up.

g-3: ^Anna: There will be plenty of time to get to know eachother better. Let's get started with the daily.
^You've been in scrum meetings before. It's the usual ritual. How do you want to act?

s: ^Wanna go for a drink after hours?

c-11: ^Anna: Well, I guess this ends the tour. Any questions?

g-4: ^Anna: If you have any questions at a later time, please feel free to ask.
